self.label: National Research Infrastructure ICOS Sweden to Abisko-Stordalen Palsa Bog

comments: The Abisko-Stordalen Palsa Bog station (with ICOS code SE-Sto) is located 10 Km east of the town of Abisko in the 1100 Ha nature reserve of Stordalen. The area is located at the 0°C isotherm which causes the permafrost in the mire to be of sporadic and of very dynamic nature. As a result of recent years warming in the area permafrost has been observed to degrade in many parts of the mires. The site is a mixed palsa-mire underlayed by sporadic permafrost under rapid degradation. Vegetation in the mire consists of sedges and sphagnum mosses in the wet parts and lichens and dwarf birch in more elevated parts of the mire.
self.label: SE-Sto

comments: Lands with a permanent mixture of water and herbaceous or woody vegetation that cover extensive areas. The vegetation can be present in either salt, brackish, or fresh water.
ecosystemType.label: Permanent Wetlands

format.label: Multi-file zip archive with ETC raw time series

self.label: ICOS ETC Eddy Flux Raw ASCII daily archive
